Description: Fragment of shoulder of Attic black-figured pottery belly amphora; interior reserved; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of lower part of lotus and palmette frieze on neck (added red on palmette) overlapped by helmet crest (decorated with incised olive leaves) belonging to warrior facing right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski gives comparisons for such overlapping helmets to Langlotz, Wurzburg I (1932) no. 247, pl. 67.84; CVA Baltimore (I) III He 43f pl. 25ff; CVA New York (3) iii H 16 22ff. pl. 21.29f, but these seem to relate to instances where the overlap is on the neck, which occurs often.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.39, no. C10, pl. 13, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0846)
